benchmark_details.name: EduVisBench
benchmark_details.overview: EduVisBench is a multi-domain, multi-level benchmark designed to evaluate the capacity of foundation models to generate pedagogically effective, step-by-step visual reasoning, featuring structured problem sets across diverse domains.
benchmark_details.data_type: STEM questions requiring visually grounded solutions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically assess FMs' ability to produce pedagogically effective visualizations for educational purposes.

data.source: C-MHChem-Benchmark, high-school-physics dataset, Illustrative Mathematics curriculum, MATH-500 dataset
data.annotation: Curated, translated, and adapted for multi-modal visualization tasks

methodology.calculation: Scores for each metric were assessed using a detailed rubric on a scale of 0 to 5.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with pedagogical standards for visual reasoning.
methodology.baseline_results: EduVisAgent achieved a score of 81.6% while baseline models scored below 58.2% on average.
methodology.validation: Scores were computed based on a fine-grained rubric across multiple visual output dimensions.
